body_html:
Yes its nice that way. I still have to look and see what made me move away from dataset. I think it was issues with switching between test and train sets on the same graph. But I had issues with that in queue's too and eventually settled with separate graphs for training and testing anyway.

Are there multiple threads working on this dataset version? Would I be save with one thread on queue's? Or might I still have compromised 'deterministic results'? ;-) Thanks anyway, it's been awesome learning tf.

body:
Yes its nice that way. I still have to look and see what made me move away from dataset. I think it was issues with switching between test and train sets on the same graph. But I had issues with that in queue's too and eventually settled with separate graphs for training and testing anyway.

Are there multiple threads working on this dataset version? Would I be save with one thread on queue's? Or might I still have compromised 'deterministic results'? ;-) Thanks anyway, it's been awesome learning tf.
